# mouseMoved(with:)

**Instance Method**

Informs the receiver that the mouse has moved.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func mouseMoved(with event: NSEvent)
```

## Parameters

- **event**: An object encapsulating information about the mouse-moved event.

## Discussion

The default implementation simply passes this message to the next responder.

## Related Documentation

- **acceptsMouseMovedEvents**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the window accepts mouse-moved events.

## Responding to Mouse Events

- **mouseDown(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the user has pressed the left mouse button.
- **mouseDragged(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the user has moved the mouse with the left button pressed.
- **mouseUp(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the user has released the left mouse button.
- **mouseEntered(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the cursor has entered a tracking rectangle.
- **mouseExited(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the cursor has exited a tracking rectangle.
- **rightMouseDown(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the user has pressed the right mouse button.
- **rightMouseDragged(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the user has moved the mouse with the right button pressed.
- **rightMouseUp(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the user has released the right mouse button.
- **otherMouseDown(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the user has pressed a mouse button other than the left or right one.
- **otherMouseDragged(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the user has moved the mouse with a button other than the left or right button pressed.
- **otherMouseUp(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the user has released a mouse button other than the left or right button.
